DOC.brief_summary: Oral estrogens may be an effective adjuvant treatment for control of acromegaly in patients with resistance to somatostatin analogs.
DOC.detailed_description: This will be a canadian multicenter study with a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled design, to assess the efficacy and safety of adjuvant alesse in female acromegalic patients with suboptimal response to sandostatin LAR treatment.
DOC.criteria: Women 18 years and older treated with somatostatin analogs Active acromegaly Cardiovascular or cerebrovascular disease Thrombophlebitis or thromboembolism Breast cancer Noncontrolled arterial hypertension Smoking Pregnancy or lactation
